news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/updates.asp?id=70497|title=Two suspects accused of Liberty ambush held|date=5 March 2009|publisher=The News(Pakistani newspaper)|accessdate=2009-03-05}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} | numpart = | dfens = [[Punjab Police (Pakistan)|Punjab Police]]/[[Elite Police]] }} {{Pakistan terrorist attacks}} The '''2009 attack on the [[Sri Lanka national cricket team]]''' occurred on 3 March 2009, when a bus carrying [[Sri Lanka]]n [[cricket]]ers, part of a larger convoy, was fired upon by 12 gunmen near [[Gaddafi Stadium]] in [[Lahore]], [[Pakistan]]. The cricketers were on their way to play the third day of the second [[Test cricket|Test]] against the [[Pakistani cricket team]]. Six members of the Sri Lanka national cricket team were wounded. Six Pakistani policemen and two civilians were killed.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/in_depth/7920260.stm|title= Gunmen shoot Sri Lanka cricketers|date=3 March 2009|work=BBC News|accessdate=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090304020128/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/in_depth/7920260.stm| archivedate= 4 March 2009 | deadurl= no|publisher=[[BBC]]}} The attack was believed to have been carried out by [[Lashkar-e-Jhangvi]]. In August 2016, three of the terrorists involved in the attack were killed during a police raid in Lahore.[http://tribune.com.pk/story/1171349/terrorists-involved-sri-lankan-cricket-team-attack-killed-lahore-raid/ Terrorists involved in Sri Lankan cricket team attack killed in Lahore raid] In October, the attack's mastermind was killed in eastern [[Afghanistan]] during a military operation, while hiding there.[http://tribune.com.pk/story/1196066/sri-lanka-cricket-team-attack-mastermind-killed-afghanistan/ ri Lanka cricket team attack mastermind 'killed' in Afghanistan] ==Background of the tour== The safety of touring cricket teams in Pakistan had long been an issue. In May 2002, [[New Zealand national cricket team|New Zealand]] abandoned their Test series in Pakistan after a [[2002 Karachi bus bombing|suicide bomb attack]] outside their hotel. However, they returned in the 2003/2004 season to fulfill their commitments.{{cite web|url=http://www.cricinfo.com/newzealand/engine/series/61139.html |title=New Zealand in Pakistan ODI Series, 2003/04 |publisher=Cricinfo |date= |accessdate=2011-12-17}} [[Australia national cricket team|Australia]] had recently refused to tour on safety grounds.{{Cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/pm/stories/s644978.htm|title=Australian cricket team cancel Pakistan tour|last=Knight|first=Ben |date=9 August 2002|work=ABC News|accessdate=3 March 2009}} [[Sri Lankan cricket team in Pakistan in 2008–09|The Sri Lankan cricket team was in Pakistan]] as a replacement for the [[India national cricket team|Indian team]], who had pulled out after the [[Mumbai attacks]].{{Cite news|url=http://content-uk.cricinfo.com/pakistan/content/story/383401.html|title=Sri Lanka have confirmed tour – Pakistan board|date=10 December 2008|work=Cricinfo Pakistan|accessdate=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090208034909/http://content-uk.cricinfo.com/pakistan/content/story/383401.html| archivedate=8 February 2009| deadurl= no}} In order to persuade the Sri Lankan team to visit, the Pakistan government offered to give them presidential-style security.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/03/04/world/asia/04pstan.html|title=For Pakistan, Attack Exposes Security Flaws |last=Perlez|first=Jane|work=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=2009-03-04| date=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090402020739/http://www.nytimes.com/2009/03/04/world/asia/04pstan.html| archivedate=2 April 2009| deadurl= no}} The series was the first Test tour of Pakistan since South Africa visited in October 2007.{{cite web|url=http://content-www.cricinfo.com/ci/engine/series/298999.html |title=Cricinfo – South Africa in Pakistan Test Series, 2007/08 |publisher=Content-www.cricinfo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-12-17}} ==Attack== [[File:Location of 2009 Liberty chowk attack.png|thumb|left|250px|Black/grey depicts the route for team convoy. The escape route for attackers is shown in blue.]] According to the officials, 12 gunmen were hiding near Liberty Square, in the centre of Lahore, waiting for the Sri Lankan team to pass on their way to the Gaddafi stadium. They started firing at the bus when it crossed the road. The [[Pakistan police]] escorting the team returned fire; in the ensuing fighting, six policemen and two civilians died. After about 20 minutes, the militants fled, leaving behind rocket launchers and grenades. The gunmen first shot at the wheels of the bus, and then fired at the bus itself and its occupants.{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4931223/Sri-Lankans-safe-and-out-of-danger-after-Pakistan-terror-attack.html|title=Sri Lankans 'safe and out of danger' after Pakistan terror attack|date=3 March 2009|work=[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]|accessdate=3 March 2009 | location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090307084008/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4931223/Sri-Lankans-safe-and-out-of-danger-after-Pakistan-terror-attack.html| archivedate= 7 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} The attackers had fired a rocket at the bus, which missed and hit a nearby electric pole. The driver of the bus, Mehar Mohammad Khalil, had then kept on driving a distance of about {{Convert|500|m|ft}} until they reached the stadium. Khalil was hailed as a hero for his bravery.{{Cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200903181732.htm|title=Pakistan honours bus driver Khalil for his brave act |date=18 March 2009|work=[[The Hindu]]|accessdate=2009-03-29|location=Chennai, India| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090322124217/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200903181732.htm| archivedate= 22 March 2009 | deadurl= yes}}{{cite web | url=http://www.news18.com/cricketnext/news/man-who-saved-sri-lankan-team-in-2009-lahore-attack-still-traumatised-995354.html | title=Man who saved Sri Lankan team in 2009 Lahore attack still traumatised | work=[[Network18]] | date=August 17, 2015 | accessdate=May 27, 2017 | agency=[[Agence France-Presse|AFP]]}} The attackers had also thrown a grenade under the bus, which exploded after the bus had passed over it. A minivan following the team bus carrying the match referee and umpires was also fired upon and the driver was killed. [[Simon Taufel]], [[Steve Davis (umpire)|Steve Davis]], [[Nadeem Ghauri]], [[Ahsan Raza]], umpires performance manager Peter Manuel, liaison officer Abdul Sami and ICC match referee [[Chris Broad]] were in this minivan. The minivan was subsequently allegedly abandoned by security personnel and no bullets were fired by the security forces for twenty minutes. [[Chris Broad]] threw himself over and kept his hand on the chest of [[Ahsan Raza]] to slow down the profuse bleeding from a bullet injury. A police officer who climbed into the minivan to seek cover drove the minivan to safety. Security cameras captured footage of several gunmen carrying automatic weapons and backpacks, firing on the convoy from the Liberty Square roundabout.{{Cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/asiapcf/03/02/pakistan.srilanka.attack/ |title=6 dead in attack on Sri Lankan cricketers |date=3 March 2009 |publisher=[[CNN]] |accessdate=2009-03-04 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090306212512/http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/asiapcf/03/02/pakistan.srilanka.attack/ |archivedate= 6 March 2009 |deadurl=no |df= }} They were later seen jogging up the street and escaping on motorcycles.{{Cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/asiapcf/03/04/pakistan.srilanka.attack/|title=Pakistan hunts for cricket attack gunmen|date=4 March 2009|publisher=CNN|accessdate=2009-03-04}} The video was broadcast around the world presenting pictures of the attacks. [[CCTV]] footage has been made public.{{Cite news|url=http://www.geo.tv/3-4-2009/36532.htm|title=Geo news airs exclusive footage of Lahore attackers|date=4 March 2009|publisher=[[Geo TV]] |accessdate=2009-03-05| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090308235745/http://www.geo.tv/3-4-2009/36532.htm| archivedate= 8 March 2009 | deadurl= yes}} They arrived at 8:39 am local time and left at 8:46 am. The attackers were armed with [[AK-47]] assault rifles, [[hand grenades]], [[Rocket-propelled grenade|RPG]] launchers, [[M18A1 Claymore Antipersonnel Mine|claymore]]s and [[explosive charge]]s.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/punjab/Mumbai-terror-visits-Lahore-hs |title=Mumbai terror visits Lahore |last=Faisal Ali |first=Muhammad |author2=Husnain Ghayoor |date=5 March 2009 |publisher=[[Dawn (newspaper)|Dawn]] |accessdate=2009-03-05 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?Id=20746|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120912204716/http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?Id=20746|dead-url=yes|archive-date=12 September 2012|title=Several Lahore attack suspects arrested|last=Perwaiz|first=Salis bin|date=5 March 2009|publisher=[[The News International]] |accessdate=2009-03-05}} The Sri Lankan team were then taken to the stadium and airlifted from the pitch via [[Pakistan Air Force]] [[Mil Mi-17|Mil Mi-17 helicopter]]s,{{Cite news|url=http://www.geosuper.tv/news_detail.asp?id=14410|title=Sri Lankan team being evacuated by helicopter|publisher=[[Geo Super]]|accessdate=2009-03-03}} and immediate arrangements were made for the Sri Lankan team to return to [[Colombo]] on the next available flight.{{Cite news|url=http://cricketnext.in.com/news/tour-cancelled-after-lanka-team-is-fired-at/38740-13.html|title=Lankan players escape with minor injuries in attack|accessdate=2009-03-03| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306113004/http://cricketnext.in.com/news/tour-cancelled-after-lanka-team-is-fired-at/38740-13.html| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} The second Test, which was the last scheduled fixture of the tour, was abandoned as a draw.{{cite web |subscription=yes |url=https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Scorecards/211/211023/211023_bbb.html|title=Pakistan v Sri Lanka in 2008/09|date=3 March 2009|publisher=CricketArchive|accessdate=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090304182846/http://www.cricketarchive.com/Archive/Scorecards/211/211023/211023_bbb.html| archivedate= 4 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} ==Injuries== Several team members sustained minor wounds, including:[[File:Mahela Jayawardene.jpg|150px|right|thumb|Sri Lankan captain [[Mahela Jayawardene]] was one of those injured.]] * [[Thilan Samaraweera]] * [[Kumar Sangakkara]] (vice-captain) * [[Tharanga Paranavitana]] * [[Ajantha Mendis]] * [[Chaminda Vaas]] * [[Mahela Jayawardene]] (captain) * [[Suranga Lakmal]] Six Pakistani policemen and two civilians were killed in the attack.{{Cite news|url=http://www.skynews.com.au/news/article.aspx?id=308388 |title=Sri Lankan cricket team in shooting |date=3 March 2009 |work=Sky News |accessdate=3 March 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090304061017/http://skynews.com.au/news/article.aspx?id=308388 |archivedate=4 March 2009 |deadurl=yes }} Samaraweera and Paranavitana were hospitalised following the incident. The others had sustained minor injuries and shrapnel wounds.{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4930665/Sri-Lanka-cricket-players-lucky-to-survive-terror-attack-in-Pakistan.html|title=Sri Lanka cricket players lucky to survive terror attack in Pakistan|last=Briggs|first=Simon |date=3 March 2009|work=The Telegraph|accessdate=3 March 2009 | location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090307005622/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4930665/Sri-Lanka-cricket-players-lucky-to-survive-terror-attack-in-Pakistan.html| archivedate= 7 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} Samaraweera sustained shrapnel wounds to his thigh, and Paranavitana to his chest.{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4931483/Sri-Lanka-cricket-attacks-Kumar-Sangakkara-injured-in-Pakistan-shooting.html|title=Sri Lanka cricket attacks: Kumar Sangakkara injured in Pakistan shooting |last=Briggs |first=Simon |date=3 March 2009|work=The Telegraph|accessdate=3 March 2009 | location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090307002437/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4931483/Sri-Lanka-cricket-attacks-Kumar-Sangakkara-injured-in-Pakistan-shooting.html| archivedate= 7 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} The team's Assistant Coach [[Paul Farbrace]] was also injured.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/7920306.stm|title= Lahore Test scrapped after attack |accessdate=2009-03-03 | work=BBC News |publisher=[[BBC]]| date=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090304172510/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/7920306.stm| archivedate= 4 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} Although it was reported that Coach [[Trevor Bayliss]] also sustained minor injuries,{{cite news|url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090303/ap_on_re_as/as_pakistan |title=Sri Lankan cricket team attacked in Pakistan |agency=Associated Press |accessdate=2009-03-03 |last=Ali |first=Rizwan |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090304184425/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090303/ap_on_re_as/as_pakistan |archivedate=4 March 2009 |deadurl=yes }}{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/ukpress/article/ALeqM5ibVbw8W41ERhnnfl-NybHJj2w4GA|title=Five Sri Lanka players injured – Sports Minister|publisher= [[The Press Association]] |accessdate=2009-03-03|last=|first=| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306211025/https://www.google.com/hostednews/ukpress/article/ALeqM5ibVbw8W41ERhnnfl-NybHJj2w4GA| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= yes}} it was later announced that this was incorrect. Reserve umpire [[Ahsan Raza]], who was travelling in a van for the umpires that was following the Sri Lankan team bus, was shot twice and taken to hospital.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-32829651 |title=In pictures: Pakistan readies for return of international cricket |accessdate=22 May 2015 |work=BBC Sport}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.sindhtoday.net/sports/70109.htm |title=Pakistani umpire critically injured in Lahore attack |accessdate=2009-03-03 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090306212941/http://www.sindhtoday.net/sports/70109.htm |archivedate=6 March 2009 |deadurl=yes }} The driver of the minibus was killed in the attack.{{Cite news|title=Chris Broad hailed as hero after Lahore attack | url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/03/lahore-sri-lanka-cricket | date=3 March 2009 | author=Bowcott, Owen | accessdate=2009-03-03 | work=Guardian | location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090304184958/http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/03/lahore-sri-lanka-cricket| archivedate= 4 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} ==Investigation and attribution== Immediately following the attacks, unnamed Pakistani authorities blamed the [[Lashkar-e-Taiba]] (LeT), a militant organisation banned in both Pakistan and India.{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5838998.ece|title=All 14 gunmen escape after deadly attack on Sri Lankan cricketers in Lahore|date=3 March 2009|work=[[Times Online]]|publisher= Times Online |accessdate=3 March 2009 | location=London | first1=Jeremy | last1=Page | first2=Jenny | last2=Booth}}[https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/strike-had-hallmarks-of-mumbai-massacre-1636831.html Strike had hallmarks of Mumbai massacre], [[The Independent]], 2009-03-03 Pakistani officials said that the attacks were similar to the Mumbai attacks. Most of the Pakistani press blamed Pakistani Islamist militants and [[Al-Qaeda]] for the attacks.[http://www.canberratimes.com.au/news/world/world/general/two-dozen-held-in-lahore-as-fbi-director-arrives/1450770.aspx Two dozen held in Lahore as FBI director arrives]{{dead link|date=September 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, [[The Canberra Times]], 2009-03-o5 Police said that kidnapping was a possible motive, but police officials refused to comment on this. [[Sri Lankan Foreign Minister]] [[Rohitha Bogollagama]] said on 4 March that he could not rule out involvement of the rebel [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam]] (LTTE) in the Lahore attacks.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?Id=20740|title=Lahore attacks| publisher=[[The News International]] |date=5 March 2009|accessdate=2009-03-05}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} Some European intelligence sources supported this suspicion.{{Cite news|url=http://www.asiantribune.com/?q=node/15896 |title=TTE-Mujahideen link suspected in attack on cricketers |date=5 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-05 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090310071430/http://www.asiantribune.com/?q=node%2F15896 |archivedate=10 March 2009 |deadurl=no |df= }} Sri Lankan military officials, on the other hand, were skeptical of LTTE involvement,{{cite news| url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/29475541/print/1/displaymode/1098/| title=Gunmen attack Sri Lankan cricket team in Pakistan|last=Ali|first=Rizwan|date=3 March 2009|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[MSNBC]]|accessdate=3 March 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} and an LTTE spokesperson labelled reports of LTTE connection as 'not true'.[http://www.ptinews.com/pti%5Cptisite.nsf/0/4D51E3CCE683A84F65257570001B7F0E?OpenDocument Press Trust of India (2009), ''LTTE denies link to Lahore attack''.]{{dead link|date=December 2011}} A junior Pakistani cabinet minister said that the government had evidence that the attackers came from India, but [[Ministry of Information, Broadcasting and National Heritage (Pakistan)|Information Minister]] [[Sherry Rehman]] denied any government knowledge of Indian involvement.{{Cite news|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/southAsiaNews/idINIndia-38317420090303?sp=true|title=Sense of crisis deepens in Pakistan after Lahore attack|first=Zeeshan|last=Haider|date=3 March 2009|work=Reuters|publisher=Reuters India|accessdate=3 March 2009}} On 6 March 2009, government officials had ruled out the involvement of Indian intelligence agency [[Research and Analysis Wing]] and LTTE and were zeroing in on Lashkar-e-Taiba.[http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/investigators+see+let+footprints+in+lahore+attack--sal-up Investigators see LeT footprints in Lahore attack]{{dead link|date=September 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, [[Dawn (newspaper)]], 2009-03-06[http://www.hindu.com/2009/03/06/stories/2009030658730100.htm Pakistan rules out Indian hand], [[The Hindu]], 2009-03-06 Sri Lankan Foreign Minister [[Rohitha Bogollagama]] was quoted as saying
From our point of view, there is no Indian involvement. India has helped us in our counter-terrorist efforts. I don't see a need for India to target the Sri Lankan cricket team.
On the morning of the attack, the Sri Lankan and Pakistani cricket teams did not depart from the hotel together, as they had done on previous days, and the Pakistani team's schedule was delayed by 5 minutes. Statements by Australian umpire Simon Taufel, match referee Chris Broad, and spin bowler [[Muttiah Muralitharan]], referencing this delay sparked [[conspiracy theories]] that the militants were acting on inside information.{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5850290.ece|title=Five-minute gap fuels conspiracy theory over Lahore terror attack|author2=Jeremy Page in Lahore and Anne Barrowclough in Sydney |date=5 March 2009|publisher=The Times|accessdate=2009-03-07 | location=London|first=Fariha|last=Karim}} Later, Muralitharan expressed alarm at such interpretations of his comments and explained that he only suspected the gunmen to be monitoring the team movements.{{Cite news|url=http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/03/06/theories-and-conspiracy-theories-on-lahore/?hp|title=Rumors and Theories About the Lahore Attack|last=Mackey|first=Robert|date=7 March 2009|work=The New York Times|accessdate=2009-03-07| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090310172928/http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/03/06/theories-and-conspiracy-theories-on-lahore/?hp| archivedate= 10 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] director [[Robert Mueller]] arrived in Pakistan the day after these attacks and met with Pakistani officials to discuss security issues and the Mumbai attacks.[http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2009/03/04/asia/AS-Pakistan-FBI-Director.php FBI chief in Pakistan after attack on cricketers], [[International Herald Tribune]], 2009-03-04 Interior Adviser Rehman Malik, told the [[National Assembly (Pakistan)#Standing Committees|National Assembly Standing Committee on the Interior]] that no evidence of LeT's involvement has been found so far, and that sufficient evidence has been surfaced pointing to involvement of a foreign hand. ===Security lapse=== The Investigation committee found three [[Superintendent (police)#Pakistan|Superintendents of police]] (SPs) to have neglected the initial warning.{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/03/sri-lanka-cricket-team-attack-warning|title=Warning of attacks on Sri Lanka cricket team was ignored |date=3 March 2009|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=2009-04-06 | location=London | first=Saeed | last=Shah| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306104828/http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/03/sri-lanka-cricket-team-attack-warning| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} by [[Intelligence news|url=http://www.ptinews.com/apti%5Cptisite.nsf/0/E6DEDC1C0235C1E165257570004C81B7?OpenDocument|title=Pak investigators identify terrorists behind SL cricket team attack|last=|first=|date=5 March web|url=http://pakistancrickethighlights.info/behind-pakistans-inconsistency-in-limited-over-cricket|title=Attack on Sri Lankan team in Lahore}} Police in Punjab arrested over 250 suspects, including 4 who were said to be 'prime suspects'. Police called Muhammad Aqeel, who ran a sports bikes business in [[Islampura]], the mastermind behind the attack, and said that he had received a call from one of the militants at 9:05 am on the morning of the attacks asking for instructions. Though Aqeel was still absconding, his brother, Muhammad Faisal, had been arrested.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009\03\05\story_5-3-2009_pg1_1| title = Police widen hunt for 3/3 clues| date = 5 March 2009|accessdate=2009-03-05| work = [[Daily Times (Pakistan)|Daily Times]]}} Police also arrested Shahzad Babar of [[Rahim Yar Khan]] after a [[Subscriber Identity Module]] (SIM) card registered in his name was used in the attack along with eight others.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/suspects+arrested+in+sri+lanka+team+attack-rs|title=Suspects arrested in Sri Lanka team attack |work = [[Dawn (newspaper)|Dawn]]| date=4 March 2009|accessdate=2009-03-05}} Security officials in [[Pakistan]] told [[The Times]] that most of the two dozen people arrested in connection with the attacks belonged to [[Jaish-e-Mohammed]], [[Lashkar-e-Jhangvi]], outlawed militant groups with close links to [[Al-Qaeda]].[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5854505.ece Gunmen who attacked cricketers in Lahore 'had links to al-Qaeda'], [[The Times]], 2009-03-06 Aqeel, who is an activist of Lashkar-e-Jhangvi, escaped a police raid on his home in [[Kahuta]] on 9 March 2009.[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5875297.ece Lahore attack 'mastermind' escapes police raid in Punjab], [[The Times]], 2009-03-09 Also another gunman Zubair, aka Naik Mohammad, of Zubair, was arrested from Madina Colony, Walton Road in Lahore. He was a waiter at a hotel in Rawalpindi, when he was recruited by Sifullah. He went to [[Miram Shah]] and was trained in the use of different weapons. Other accused including Samiullah, alias Ejaz of [[Nankana Sahib District|Nankana district]], Adnan, alias Sajjad, Ajmal alias Ahsaan, Farooq, Ameer of Punjab [[Taliban]], and Umer, alias Abdul Wahab of [[D. I. Khan]], were still at large. The attack was planned at Tauheed Hotel, and a house rented for this purpose in Madina Colony, Walton Road. The [[auto rickshaws]] used in the attack were purchased by Samiullah. A secret investigative report has surfaced later prepared by the Additional Inspector General of the Crime Investigation Division, Punjab on 22 January 2009 outlining the potential threat to the Sri Lankan team.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/11-police-track-mastermind-of-attack-on-lankan-cricket-team--il--04|title=Sri Lankan team attack ''[[DAWN (newspaper)]]'' condemned the attack and cited security loopholes.{{cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/lahore-attacks-in-the-urdu-press-ha |title=Lahore attacks in the Urdu press |date=4 March 2009 |publisher=Dawn(Pakistani newspaper) |accessdate=2009-03-05 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The [[Daily Times (Pakistan)|''Daily Times'']], blamed Al Qaeda and Lashkar-e Jhangvi in an editorial, stating, "International cricket is no longer possible in Pakistan; therefore we should stop accusing foreign teams of discriminating against Pakistan vis-à-vis India. The question here is of the survival of Pakistan, not of cricket."{{cite web|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009\story_4-3-2009_pg3_1 |title=EDITORIAL: Al Qaeda strikes in Lahore |publisher=Dailytimes.com.pk |date= |accessdate=2011-12-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090307203236/http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009%5C03%5C04%5Cstory_4-3-2009_pg3_1 |archivedate= 7 March 2009 |df= }} The ''[[Daily Jang]]'', responding on Chris Broad, Simon Taufel and Steve Davis's comments, said that their "vivid description of the terrifying attack gives us an insight into how people everywhere will see the events of the morning of March 3." The paper goes on to say that "their candid comments will seal the fate of Pakistan cricket for some time to come". It also said that Pakistan "must give up complaining" and that "ways to liven up the game at the domestic level need to be reconsidered with renewed urgency".[http://thenews.jang.com.pk/daily_detail.asp?id=165953 First-hand nightmares – The News] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090827054147/http://thenews.jang.com.pk/daily_detail.asp?id=165953 |date=27 August 2009 }}. {{LKA}} – President, [[Mahinda Rajapaksa]], said, "I condemn this cowardly terrorist attack targeting the Sri Lankan cricket team. The Sri Lankan players had gone to Pakistan as ambassadors of goodwill."{{cite news|url=http://www.khaleejtimes.com/DisplayArticle08.asp?xfile=data/international/2009/March/international_March182.xml§ion=international |title=Lankan president condemns attack |date=3 March 2009 |work=AFP |publisher=Khaleej Times |accessdate=3 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110608195443/http://www.khaleejtimes.com/DisplayArticle08.asp?xfile=data%2Finternational%2F2009%2FMarch%2Finternational_March182.xml§ion=international |archivedate=8 June 2011 |df= }} Prime Minister [[Ratnasiri Wickremanayake]] said that "Sri Lanka and Pakistan share a [[Pakistan-Sri Lanka relations|very close relationship]] and we will take all steps to protect this relationship."[http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/000200903041941.htm Ties with Pakistan will continue: Sri Lankan PM] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121103230016/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/000200903041941.htm |date=3 November 2012 }}. The driver of the bus whose presence of mind saved the cricketers was hailed as a hero.[http://sundaytimes.lk/090308/News/sundaytimesnews_13.html Mehar Mohammad Khalil: A hero across borders], [[The Sunday Times (Sri Lanka)|The Sunday Times]], 2009-03-08 The Sri Lankan team praised the bus driver. Then-captain of [[Sri Lanka]] [[Mahela Jayawardene]] praised Khalil saying he owed his life to the driver. Spinner [[Muttiah Muralitharan]] gave Khalil his team shirt.[http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2009/03/05/1235842498871.html Lankans home, thank bus driver ], ''[[The Age]]'', 2009-03-05. ===Supranational=== ===Others=== {{Flag|United Nations}} – Secretary General [[Ban Ki Moon]] strongly condemned the attacks according to UN spokesman Marie Okabe. She also added that "Any attack targeting civilians, in this case athletes, is despicable and unjustifiable, and we urge authorities in Pakistan to do all in their power to find the culprits and bring them to justice."{{cite web |url=http://india.gov.in/outerwin.php?id=http://www.ddinews.gov.in/International/International+-+Other+Stories/un+attack.htm |title=National Portal of India |publisher=India.gov.in |date= |accessdate=2010-09-20}} The [[International Cricket Council]] – Chief Executive [[Haroon Lorgat]] said:
We note with dismay and regret the events of this morning in Lahore and we condemn this attack without reservation. It is a source of great sadness that there have been a number of fatalities in this attack and it is also very upsetting for the wider cricket family that some of the Sri Lanka players and one match official have been injured in this attack. At this time our thoughts and prayers are with the injured people and also the families of those who have died.{{cite press release|url=http://icc-cricket.yahoo.com/media-release/2009/march/media-release20090303-5.html |title=ICC statement following terror attack in Lahore |date=3 March 2009 |publisher=International Cricket Council |accessdate=3 March 2009 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}
The [[West Indies Cricket Board]] made a statement through president [[Julian Hunte]] and said "It was a sad day for International Cricket", and gave their full sympathy to the Sri Lankan players and the umpires.[https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5ixlQrMPilkjn3RssZ53ZHlbL-XuA xxx]. Indian and New Zealand players wore black armbands while playing their next One Day International as a show of solidarity towards the Sri Lankan players injured in the attack,[http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/007200903031813.htm Lahore attack: India, NZ players sport black armbands] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120126153631/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/007200903031813.htm |date=26 January 2012 }}, [[The Hindu]], 2009-03-03. as did Australia and South Africa while playing their next test.{{original research inline|date=November 2014}} ===Other countries=== {{AUS}} – Prime Minister [[Kevin Rudd]] also condemned the attack on the Sri Lankan cricket team, calling it "shameful and cowardly".{{cite news |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2009/03/04/2507291.htm?section=sport |title=Rudd denounces 'doubly atrocious' Lahore attack |publisher=[[ABC News (Australia)]] |date=4 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-04| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090308235928/http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2009/03/04/2507291.htm?section=sport| archivedate= 8 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} He demanded answers from Pakistan after claims that police left Australians travelling with Sri Lanka's cricket team in the lurch as the bus was attacked. "I am sufficiently concerned about what has been said by the Australians that we need an explanation and we intend to get one."[http://www.canberratimes.com.au/news/local/news/general/lahore-link-to-alqaeda-as-suspects-identified/1452965.aspx Lahore link to al-Qaeda as suspects identified] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090308053347/http://www.canberratimes.com.au/news/local/news/general/lahore-link-to-alqaeda-as-suspects-identified/1452965.aspx |date=8 March 2009 }}, ''[[The Canberra Times]]'', 2009-03-7. I read two, three names ... Samaraweera, Mendis ... I hope they are safe and will recover. ''[[The Guardian]]'', 4 March 2009. [[Match referee]] [[Chris Broad]] was also critical of the security provided. He stated that he and his colleagues were left like 'sitting ducks' in the trailing minivan during the attack.[http://uk.reuters.com/article/sportsNews/idUKTRE5232PY20090304 "Broad slams security over Lahore attack"]. [[Reuters]], 2009-03-04. He also accused the security personnel of fleeing the scene.[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/05/lahore-terror-attacks-chris-broad "Police left us like sitting ducks, says referee"], ''[[The Guardian]]'', 2009-03-05. He questioned why the Pakistan team which usually travelled with the Sri Lankan team was delayed by seven minutes that day and avoided being attacked.[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5854504.ece "Seven-minute delay that kept Pakistan's cricket squad from harm"], ''[[The Times]]'', 2009-03-06. [[Javed Miandad]] was critical of Broad's comments and demanded that International Cricket Council ban him for life.[https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2009/mar/06/miandad-broad-ban-lahore "Miandad demands life ban for outspoken Broad"], ''[[The Guardian]]'', 2009-03-06. [[Pakistan Cricket Board]] lodged a formal complaint against Chris Broad with the International Cricket Council on 9 March 2009.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/cricket/7934423.stm "Pakistan register Broad complaint"], ''[[BBC News]]'', 2009-03-10. Ijaz Butt, the head of Pakistan Cricket Board accused Broad of lying.[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/pakistan/4944703/Sri-Lankan-cricketers-Pakistan-accuses-Chris-Broad-of-lying-about-terror-attack.html "Pakistan accuses Chris Broad of lying about terror attack"], ''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]'', 2009-03-06. Umpire [[Simon Taufel]] also said that the umpire's minibus was abandoned while the players' bus was moved to the ground to evacuate the players.{{cite news |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2009/03/05/2508022.htm |title=Aussie umpires slam Pakistan security arrangements |date=5 March 2009 |work=ABC News |accessdate=2009-03-05| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306213458/http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2009/03/05/2508022.htm| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} Criticising the security entourage for abandoning them and inability of the police to arrest the attackers Simon said, "You tell me why no one was caught. You tell me why. Supposedly 25 armed commandos were in our convoy, and when the team bus got going again, we were left on our own." Co-umpire [[Steve Davis (umpire)|Steve Davis]] said "he felt let down" by the security. International Cricket Council umpires performance manager for East Asia, Sri Lanka and Pakistan, Peter Manuel told ''[[Dawn (newspaper)|Dawn]]'' that the minivan carrying the umpires was basically abandoned by the security personnel: "It was unbelievable. Bullets were raining on us and not a shot was fired in our defense by the Pakistan security officials."[http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn+content+library/dawn/news/pakistan/we-were-basically-abandoned-szh We were basically abandoned']{{dead link|date=September 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, [[Dawn (newspaper)|''Dawn'']], 2009-03-8. Sri Lanka coach [[Trevor Bayliss]] backed the comments made by [[Simon Taufel]], Chris Broad and Steve Davis criticising the security.[http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12123_5031669,00.html "Bayliss backs officials"], ''[[Sky Sports]]'', 2009-03-10. Intikhab Alab, Pakistan cricket team's coach, asked Chris Broad to apologise to his country and team due to the remarks he made against Pakistani police security.[http://dailymailnews.com/200903/13/news/dmsportspage01.html "Intikhab asks Broad to apologize for remarks"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090808065751/http://dailymailnews.com/200903/13/news/dmsportspage01.html |date=8 August 2009 }}, ''The Daily Mail'' (Pakistan). English cricketer [[Dominic Cork]] who was commentating in Pakistan on the series and who himself was caught in the attack later criticised the security and Pakistan Cricket Board chairman [[Ijaz Butt]].{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12123_5009385,00.html|title=Cork slams PCB chief|date=5 March 2009|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=12 March 2011}} Sri Lankan bowler [[Muttiah Muralitharan]] said the security arrangement was the worst he had ever seen, and vastly inferior to that provided in [[Sri Lanka]]. He said "The security people we had didn't even seem to fight back. Were they professionals with enough training? They didn't seem to know what to do. I was surprised the terrorists were able to just reload the magazines and keep firing, and they never got caught. It was shameful. If this had happened in [[Colombo]] they would never have got away."[http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2009/03/06/1235842584734.html "Lahore security was shameful, says Murali"], ''[[The Age]]'', 2009-03-06. Eye witness Habib Akram, bureau chief of [[SAMAA TV]] news channel, said that the gunmen were very calm as they moved and fired by turns and that there was hardly any fire returned by the police. His office overlooks the traffic circle where the incident took place.{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601081&sid=akGSVrqD10aI&refer=australia |title=Pakistan Shows Tape of Gunmen Escaping After Attack (Update2) |date=5 March 2009 |work=ABC News |first=Khalid Qayum |last=Ed Johnson |accessdate=2009-03-05}} [[Closed-circuit television]] footage of the event reported by [[Geo TV]] showed four of the attackers walking or jogging away unchallenged from the site, into a marketplace while no policemen are seen. Former president and former army chief [[Pervez Musharraf]] criticised the police commandos inability to kill any of the gunmen, saying "If this was the [[Elite Police|elite force]] I would expect them to have shot down those people who attacked them, the reaction, their training should be on a level that if anyone shoots toward the company they are guarding, in less than three seconds they should shoot the man down."[http://www.voanews.com/english/2009-03-05-voa13.cfm "Pakistan Cricket Ambush Controversy Focuses on Security"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090307112722/http://www.voanews.com/english/2009-03-05-voa13.cfm |date=7 March 2009 }}, ''[[Voice of America]]'', 2009-03-05.{{cite news |url=http://www.gulfnews.com/world/Pakistan/10292058.html |title=Elite force should have killed terrorists |last=Rehman Khan |first=Fasihur |date=5 March 2009 |publisher=Gulfnews |accessdate=2009-03-07 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090307100348/http://www.gulfnews.com/world/Pakistan/10292058.html |archivedate=7 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Governor of Punjab province where the attack took place in Pakistan, gave medals and awards to honour valour and bravery of police officials for fighting the terrorists during the attack.[http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=70205&Itemid=2 "Gallantry medals given to valiant police officials"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090827090514/http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=70205&Itemid=2 |date=27 August 2009 }}, [[Associated Press of Pakistan]]. ==Aftermath== Insurance costs for cricket matches in India, Pakistan, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka rose.Mayur Shetty (4 March 2009), "[http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/Lahore-attack-Terror-cover-to-cost-more/articleshow/4220745.cms Lahore attack: Terror cover to cost more for IPL franchisees]". ''Economic Times''. The [[New Zealand national cricket team|New Zealand]] team cancelled its December 2009 tour of Pakistan.[http://content-www.cricinfo.com/pakistan/content/current/story/393259.html "Pakistan's World Cup hopes under threat"]. Cricinfo. [[Bangladesh]] also put off a scheduled tour by Pakistan to Bangladesh."[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/cricket/7925471.stm Pakistan's tour of Bangladesh off]". [[BBC News]], 2009-03-05. The Union Home Minister of India, [[P. Chidambaram]], said that the [[Indian Premier League]] should consider postponing the forthcoming [[Twenty20|T20]] league matches due to be held over 45 days from 10 April to 24 May 2009 in 9 Indian cities, since in the light of these attacks, security forces would be stretched too thin between the league matches and the five phases of the [[Indian general election, 2009|forthcoming general elections]] in India.{{cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200903032187.htm |title=PC suggests postponement of T-20 tournament |work=The Hindu |date=3 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-04 |location=Chennai, India |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121103230008/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200903032187.htm |archivedate=3 November 2012 |df= }} The elections were slated to be held between 16 April and 13 May and it was impossible to reschedule them while IPL organizers appeared to be unwilling to postpone the tournament.{{cite news |url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1090304/jsp/frontpage/story_10621948.jsp |title=IPL resists govt pressure to postpone spectacle |work=The Telegraph |date=4 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-04 |location=Calcutta, India| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306205007/http://telegraphindia.com/1090304/jsp/frontpage/story_10621948.jsp| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} Former [[England national cricket team|England]] coach [[Duncan Fletcher]] said that English players contracted to the IPL would now be more concerned for their safety.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/sport/blog/2009/mar/04/duncan-fletcher-sri-lanka-lahore-attack |title=England stars must think again about playing in the IPL |author=Duncan Fletcher |work=TheSportsBlog |date=4 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-04 |location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090305074410/http://www.guardian.co.uk/sport/blog/2009/mar/04/duncan-fletcher-sri-lanka-lahore-attack| archivedate= 5 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} The [[2009 Indian Premier League]] was hosted by South Africa between 18 April and 24 May 2009. Former Indian captain [[Sourav Ganguly]] said after these attacks Pakistan not a safe venue to play cricket."[http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2009-03-08/patna/28053087_1_cricket-team-new-zealander-john-wright-south-african-gary-kirsten Pak not a safe venue for playing cricket: Ganguly]". ''[[The Times of India]]'', 2009-03-08. The [[2011 Cricket World Cup]] was to be co-hosted by [[Pakistan]], [[India]], [[Sri Lanka]] and [[Bangladesh]], but in the wake of this attack on the [[Sri Lanka national cricket team|Sri Lankan cricket team]] the [[International Cricket Council]] (ICC) stripped Pakistan of its hosting rights due to security concerns.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/other_international/pakistan/8004684.stm |title=No World Cup matches in Pakistan |publisher=BBC |accessdate=2009-04-17 |date=18 April 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090418013231/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/other_international/pakistan/8004684.stm| archivedate= 18 April 2009 | deadurl= no}} The headquarters of the organising committee were originally situated in Lahore, but was then shifted to Mumbai.{{cite web |url=http://content.cricinfo.com/india/content/current/story/401726.html |title=World Cup shifts base from Lahore to Mumbai |publisher=Cricinfo |accessdate=2009-04-17| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090430031240/http://content.cricinfo.com/india/content/current/story/401726.html| archivedate= 30 April 2009 | deadurl= no}} Pakistan was supposed to hold 14 matches, including one semi-final.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/other_international/pakistan/8004684.stm |title=Pakistan counts cost of Cup shift |publisher=BBC |accessdate=2009-04-18 |date=18 April 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090418013231/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/other_international/pakistan/8004684.stm| archivedate= 18 April 2009 | deadurl= no}} Eight of Pakistan's matches were awarded to India, four to Sri Lanka and two to Bangladesh.{{cite web |url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gjlcwb7FGlFoUn2QjftFetKAeYOQ |title=Pakistan nears solution to World Cup dispute |publisher=AFP |accessdate=2009-07-31}} The Sri Lankan Foreign minister has said the Sri Lankan cricket team "will give highest consideration to the invitation extended to it to undertake visit again. Sri Lanka will not allow Pakistan's isolation in cricket." In October 2017, the Sri Lankan cricket team [[Sri Lankan cricket team against Pakistan in the UAE in 2017–18#3rd T20I|returned to Pakistan]] for the first time since the attack to play a [[Twenty20 International]] match at the Gaddafi Stadium.{{cite web |url=http://www.espncricinfo.com/series/18037/preview/1120293/ |title=Lahore readies itself for that international feeling |accessdate=29 October 2017 |work=ESPN Cricinfo}} ==See also== {{wikinews|Seven killed in gun attack on Sri Lankan cricket team}} * [[Attack on Pakistani ambassador to Sri Lanka]] * [[2010 Togo national football team bus attack]] * [[List of terrorist incidents in Pakistan since 2001]] * [[Sri Lankan cricket team in Pakistan in 2008–09]] * [[Terrorism in Pakistan]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[https://www.theguardian.com/world/sri-lanka-cricket-team-attack The Guardian's portal on the attack] *[http://english.aljazeera.net/sport/2009/03/20093121222845373.html New captain Sangakkara interviewed after the attack] {{Cricket in Sri Lanka}} {{International cricket tours of Pakistan}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sri Lanka national cricket team attack}} [[Category:2009 in Sri Lankan cricket]] [[Category:Mass murder in 2009]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in Pakistan in 2009]] [[Category:History of Pakistani cricket]] [[Category:History of Sri Lankan cricket]] [[Category:Pakistan–Sri Lanka relations]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents on buses]] [[Category:Mass shootings]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in Lahore]] [[Category:Deaths by firearm in Pakistan]] [[Category:Violence in sports]] [[Category:Lashkar-e-Jhangvi attacks]] [[Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in the 2000s]] [[Category:Gaddafi Stadium]] [[Category:Accidents and incidents involving sports teams]] [[Category:Cricket tours abandoned due to terrorism]]

page.title: Access to public information in Slovenia

revision.text:
{{see also|Access to public information in Europe}}
'''Access to public information''' and '''[[freedom of information]] (FOI)''' refer to the right of access to information held by public bodies also known as "right to know". Access to public information is considered of fundamental importance for the effective functioning of democratic systems, as it enhances governments' and public officials' accountability, boosting people participation and allowing their informed participation into public life. The fundamental premise of the right of access to public information is that the information held by governmental institutions is in principle public and may be concealed only on the basis of legitimate reasons which should be detailed in the law.<ref>[http://www.unesco.org/new/en/communication-and-information/freedom-of-expression/freedom-of-information Freedom of Information, UNESCO. {{Retrieved|access-date=2016-10-16}}]</ref>
In [[Slovenia]], access to public information is guaranteed by Article 39 of the Constitution that protects freedom of speech and right of access to public information. The constitutional right of access to public information is embodied in the Access to Public Information Act adopted in 2004. In Slovenia everyone has the right to obtain information of a public nature in which he/she has a well grounded legal interest under the law, with the only exceptions provided by law. The Access to Public Information Act also enables every citizen to enjoy the right enshrined by Article 44 of the Constitution to actively participate in the management of public affairs.<ref name=DP-RS>{{cite web |url=http://www.dp-rs.si/en/public_information/ |title=Public Information |last= |first= |date= |website=Dp-rs.si |publisher=Republic of Slovenia. state Attorney's Office |access-date=16 February 2017 |quote=}}</ref>
==Legal framework== Slovenia has a good regulatory framework on access to public information.<ref name=ASPA>{{cite journal |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=2013 |title=Building Good Governance by Access to Information in Administrative Matters - Trends in Slovenia, Croatia and Serbia |url=http://www.nispa.org/files/conferences/2013/papers/ASPA-NewOrleans-March-13-Right-to-info-KovacPolonca.pdf |journal=ASPA Conference, New Orleans, March 2013. NISPAcee panel, Openness and accountability in CEE: building sustainable governance? |access-date= 16 February 2017}}</ref> Slovenia's Access to Information Law is considered as one of the best in Europe.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.access-info.org/decision-making-transparency/legal-analysis |title=The RTI Map |last= |first= |date= |website=Access-info.org |publisher=Access-Info Europe |access-date=17 February 2017|quote=}}</ref>
Slovenian Constitution, adopted in 1991, for the first time legally defined a right to access to public information.<ref name=avosetta>{{cite journal |author=Rajko Knez |date=2015 |title=Free Access to environmental information. Report - Slovenia |url=http://avosetta.jura.uni-bremen.de/repslovenia2015.pdf |journal=Avosetta Annual Meeting on 29/30 May 2015 in Bremen |access-date= 10 January 2017}}</ref>
In Slovenia access to public information is regulated by the '''Access to Public Information Act (2004)''', the Decree on communication and re-use of information of a public nature (2005) and the decree amending it (2007), and the Information Commissioner Act (2005).<ref name=DP-RS/>
The aim of the Slovenian Access to Public Information Act is to ensure that the work of public bodies is open and transparent and to enable natural and legal entities to exercise their rights to obtain public information from public authorities holding such information. In order to achieve this aim, the law prescribes that public authorities have to obligation to inform the public about their work to the greatest extend possible.<ref name=DP-RS/>
The law defines the information to be considered as "public" stipulating that public information subject to access to information law refers to information and data originating from the field of work of public authorities, regardless of its form or origin.<ref name=DP-RS/>
Exceptions to the rule of disclosure are defined in Article 6 of the Law. Reasons for refusing can be due to the sensitive nature of the information requested, for instance information defined as classified pursuant the Act governing classified data, or information concerning personal data, or when disclosure of such information would prejudice the implementation of a judicial or administrative procedure.<ref name=DP-RS/>
Public authorities are obliged to provide access to information both to Slovenian and foreign nationals, including the foreign media.<ref name=EBRD>{{cite journal |date=2014 |title=Commercial laws of Slovenia. An assessment by the EBRD |url=http://www.ebrd.com/documents/legal-reform/slovenia-country-law-assessment.pdf |publisher=European Bank for Reconstruction and Development|access-date= 16 February 2017}}</ref> Relevant bodies have to make a decision on a FOI request within 20 business days: this term may be extended to a maximum of 30 business days in case of requests requiring a complex compilation of the documents sought. In case a response is not provided within the designed period of time the application is considered refused and the applicant may file a complaint with the [[Information commissioner|Information Commissioner]].<ref name=EBRD/>
In 2005, the Information Commissioner Act established the institution of the Information Commissioner, an autonomous and independent body in charge of supervising the protection of personal data and the access to public information. The Commissioner is appointed by the National Assembly at the proposal of the President of the Republic.<ref name=Slovenia.si>{{cite web |url=http://www.sloveniatimes.com/officials-stress-importance-of-access-to-public-information |title=Officials Stress Importance of Access to Public Information |last= |first= |date=29 September 2015 |website=Sloveniatimes.com |publisher=The Slovenia Times |access-date=16 February 2017 |quote=}}</ref>
==Access to public information in practice== {{Expand section|date=February 2017}}
When the right of access to public information was first introduced into the Constitution, most of Slovenians were not aware of this right. According to some experts, it tooks a decade for the right to be known, accepted and used by citizens of Slovenia.<ref name=avosetta/> The right of access to public information is most widely used by journalists and NGOs, while citizens are requesting public information under the FOI law more and more frequently.<ref name=avosetta/>
On the occasion of the [[International Right to Know Day]] celebrated on September 28th 2015, Information Commissioner Mojce Prelesnik highlighted that a key problem affecting the right of access to public information in Slovenia is the failure of state institutions to store certain data, which is particularly problematic in fields such as environmental protection, healthy food and consumer protection.<ref name=Slovenia.si/>
==See also== * [[Access to public information in Europe]] * [[Freedom of information]] * [[Freedom of information laws by country]] * [[Transparency of media ownership in Europe]] * [[Media of Slovenia]] * [[Media of Slovenia#Transparency of media owenrship|Transparency of media ownership in Slovenia]]

In [[mathematical physics]], the '''[[Frederik Belinfante|Belinfante]]–[[Léon Rosenfeld|Rosenfeld]] tensor''' is a modification of the energy–momentum tensor that is constructed from the canonical energy–momentum tensor and the spin current so as to be symmetric yet still conserved.
In a [[classical field theory|classical]] or [[quantum field theory|quantum]] local field theory, the generator of [[Lorentz transformation]]s can be written as an integral
: <math>M_{\mu\nu} = \int \mathrm{d}^3x \, {M^0}_{\mu\nu}</math>
of a local current
: <math>{M^\mu}_{\nu\lambda}= (x_\nu {T^\mu}_\lambda - x_\lambda {T^\mu}_\nu)+ {S^\mu}_{\nu\lambda}.</math>
Here <math>{T^\mu}_\lambda</math> is the canonical [[Noether's theorem|Noether]] [[energy–momentum tensor]], and <math> {S^{\mu}}_{\nu\lambda}</math> is the contribution of the intrinsic (spin) [[angular momentum]]. Local conservation of angular momentum
: <math>\partial_\mu {M^\mu}_{\nu\lambda}=0 \, </math>
requires that
: <math>\partial_\mu {S^\mu}_{\nu\lambda}=T_{\lambda\nu}-T_{\nu\lambda}.</math>
Thus a source of [[spin tensor|spin-current]] implies a non-symmetric canonical energy–momentum tensor.
The Belinfante–Rosenfeld tensor<ref name="belinfante">{{cite journal|author=F. J. Belinfante|title=On the current and the density of the electric charge, the energy, the linear momentum and the angular momentum of arbitrary fields |journal=Physica |volume=7| page=449| year=1940|doi=10.1016/S0031-8914(40)90091-X|bibcode=1940Phy.....7..449B}}</ref><ref name="rosenfeld">{{cite journal|author=L. Rosenfeld |title=Sur le tenseur D’Impulsion-Energie |journal=Acad. Roy. Belg. Memoirs de classes de Science |volume=18 |issue =fasc. 6|year=1940}}</ref> is a modification of the energy momentum tensor
: <math>T_B^{\mu\nu} = T^{\mu\nu} +\frac 12 \partial_\lambda(S^{\mu\nu\lambda}+S^{\nu\mu\lambda}-S^{\lambda\nu\mu})</math>
that is constructed from the canonical energy momentum tensor and the spin current <math> {S^{\mu}}_{\nu\lambda}</math> so as to be symmetric yet still conserved.
An integration by parts shows that
: <math>M^{\nu\lambda} = \int (x^\nu T^{0\lambda}_B - x^\lambda T^{0\nu}_B) \, \mathrm{d}^3x,</math>
and so a physical interpretation of Belinfante tensor is that it includes the "bound momentum" associated with gradients of the intrinsic angular momentum. In other words, the added term is an analogue of the <math> {\mathbf J}_\text{bound}= \nabla\times \mathbf {M}</math> "[[bound current]]" associated with a magnetization density <math>{\mathbf M}</math>.
The curious combination of spin-current components required to make <math> T_B^{\mu\nu}</math> symmetric and yet still conserved seems totally ''ad hoc'', but it was shown by both Rosenfeld and Belinfante that the modified tensor is precisely the symmetric Hilbert energy–momentum tensor that acts as the source of gravity in [[general relativity]]. Just as it is the sum of the bound and free currents that acts as a source of the magnetic field, it is the sum of the bound and free energy–momentum that acts as a source of gravity.
==Belinfante-Rosenfeld and the Hilbert energy-momentum tensor==
The Hilbert energy-momentum tensor <math>T_{\mu\nu}</math> is defined by the variation of the action functional <math>S_{\rm eff}</math> with respect to the metric as
<math>\delta S_{\rm eff}=\frac 12 \int d^nx \sqrt{g} \,T_{\mu\nu}\,\delta g^{\mu\nu},</math>
or equivalently as
<math>\delta S_{\rm eff}=-\frac 12 \int d^nx \sqrt{g} \,T^{\mu\nu}\,\delta g_{\mu\nu}. </math>
(The minus sign in the second equation arises because <math> \delta g^{\mu\nu}= - g^{\mu\sigma} \delta g_{\sigma\tau} g^{\tau\nu}</math>.)
We may also define an energy-momentum tensor <math>T_{cb}</math> by varying a Minkowski-orthonormal vierbein <math> {\bf e}_a</math> to get
<math> \delta S_{\rm eff}= \int d^nx\sqrt{g}\left( \frac{\delta S}{\delta e^\mu_a}\right) \delta e^\mu_a \equiv \int d^nx\sqrt{g} \left(T_{cb} \eta^{ca} e^{*b}_\mu\right) \delta e^\mu_a.</math>
Here <math> \eta_{ab} = {\bf e}_a \cdot {\bf e}_b </math> is the Minkowski metric for the orthonormal vierbein frame, and <math>{\bf e}^{*b}</math> are the covectors dual to the vierbeins.
With the vierbein variation there is no immediately obvious reason for <math>T_{cb}</math> to be symmetric. However, the action functional <math> S_{\rm eff}({\bf e}_a) </math> should be invariant under an infinitesimal local Lorentz transformation <math>\delta e^\mu_a= e^\mu_b {\theta^{b}}_a(x)</math>, <math>\theta^{ab}=-\theta^{ba}</math>, and so
<math>\delta S_{\rm eff} = \int d^nx\sqrt{g} \,T_{cb}\,\eta^{ca} e^{*b}_\mu e^\mu_d {\theta^d}_a = \int d^nx\sqrt{g} \,T_{cb}\,\eta^{ca} {\theta^b}_a = \int d^nx\sqrt{g}\, T_{cb}\, \theta^{bc}(x), </math>
should be zero. As <math>\theta^{bc}(x)</math> is an arbitrary position-dependent skew symmetric matrix, we see that local Lorentz and rotation invariance both requires and implies that <math>T_{bc}=T_{cb}</math>.
Once we know that <math>T_{ab}</math> is symmetric, it is easy to show that <math>T_{ab}= e_a^\mu e_b^\nu T_{\mu\nu}</math>, and so the vierbein-variation energy-momentum tensor is equivalent to the metric-variation Hilbert tensor.
We can now understand the origin of the Belinfante-Rosefeld modification of the Noether canonical energy momentum tensor. Take the action to be <math>S_{\rm eff}({\bf e}_a, {\omega}^{ab}_\mu )</math> where <math>{\omega}^{ab}_\mu</math> is the spin connection that is determined by <math>{\bf e}_a</math> via the condition of being metric compatible and torsion free. The spin current <math>{S^\mu}_{ab}</math> is then defined by the variation
<math> {S^\mu}_{ab}= \frac{2}{\sqrt g} \left(\frac{\delta S_{\rm eff}}{\delta \omega^{ab}_\mu}\right)_{{\bf e}_a}, </math>
and the "canonical" Noether energy momentum tensor <math>T^{(0)}_{cb}</math> is the part that arises from the variation where we keep the spin connection fixed:
<math> T_{cb} ^{(0)} \eta^{ca} e^{*b}_\mu= \frac{1}{\sqrt{g}}\left(\frac{\delta S_{\rm eff}}{\delta e^\mu_a}\right)_{\omega^{ab}_\mu}. </math>
Then
<math> \delta S_{\rm eff} = \int d^nx \sqrt{g} \left\{ T_{cb} ^{(0)} \eta^{ca} e^{*b}_\mu \delta e^\mu_a+ \frac 12 {S^{\mu}}_{ab} \delta {\omega^{ab}}_\mu\right\}. </math>
Now, for a torsion-free and metric-compatible connection, we have that
<math> (\delta \omega_{ij\mu}) e^\mu_k =-\frac 12\left\{(\nabla_j \delta e_{ik} - \nabla_k \delta e_{ij}) +( \nabla_k \delta e_{ji}- \nabla_i \delta e_{jk}) -( \nabla_i \delta e_{kj}-\nabla_j \delta e_{ki})\right\}, </math>
where we are using the notation
<math> \delta e_{ij} = {\bf e}_i\cdot \delta {\bf e}_j= \eta_{ib}[e^{*b}_\alpha \delta e_j^\alpha]. </math>
Using the spin-connection variation, and after an integration by parts, we find
<math> \delta S_{\rm eff} = \int d^nx \sqrt{g} \left\{ T_{cb} ^{(0)} +\frac 12 \nabla_a({S_{bc}}^a+{S_{cb}}^a-{S^a}_{bc})\right\} \eta^{cd}e^{*b}_\mu \,\delta e_d^\mu. </math>
Thus we see that corrections to the canonical Noether tensor that appear in the Belinfante-Rosenfeld tensor occur because we need to simultaneously vary the vierbein and the spin connection if we are to preserve local Lorentz invariance.
As an example, consider the classical Lagrangian for the Dirac field
<math> \int d^dx\sqrt{g}\left\{ \frac i 2 \left( \bar \Psi \gamma^a e^\mu_a\nabla_\mu \Psi - (\nabla_\mu \bar\Psi)e^\mu_a \gamma_a \Psi\right)+m\bar\Psi\Psi \right\}. </math>
Here the spinor covariant derivatives are
<math> \nabla_\mu \Psi =\left(\frac{\partial}{\partial x^\mu}+\frac 18 [\gamma_b,\gamma_c] {\omega^{bc}}_\mu\right) \Psi, </math>
<math> \nabla_\mu\bar \Psi =\left(\frac{\partial}{\partial x^\mu}-\frac 18 [\gamma_b,\gamma_c] {\omega^{bc}}_\mu\right) \bar\Psi. </math>
We therefore get
<math> T^{(0)}_{bc}= \frac i2\left(\bar \Psi \gamma_c( \nabla_b\Psi) -(\nabla_b \bar \Psi)\gamma_c \Psi\right), </math>
<math> {S^a}_{bc}= \frac i8 \bar\Psi\{\gamma^a,[\gamma_b,\gamma_c]\}\Psi. </math>
There is no contribution from <math>\sqrt{g}</math> if we use the equations of motion.
Now <math> \{\gamma_a,[\gamma_b,\gamma_c]\}=4 \gamma_a\gamma_b\gamma_c, </math> if <math>a,b c</math> are distinct and zero otherwise. As a consequence <math>S_{abc}</math> is totally antisymmetric. Now, using this result, and again the equations of motion, we find that
<math> \nabla_a {S^a}_{bc}= T^{(0)}_{cb}-T^{(0)}_{bc}, </math>
Thus the Belinfante-Rosenfeld tensor becomes
<math> T_{bc} = T^{(0)}_{bc}+ \frac 12(T^{(0)}_{cb}-T^{(0)}_{bc}) = \frac 12 (T^{(0)}_{bc}+T^{(0)}_{cb}). </math>
The on-shell Belinfante-Rosenfeld tensor for the Dirac field is therefore seen to be the symmetrized canonical energy-momentum tensor.
==Weinberg's definition==
Weinberg defines the Belinfante tensor as<ref>{{cite book|last1=Weinberg|first1=Steven|title=The quantum theory of fields|date=2005|publisher=[[Cambridge Univ. Press]]|location=Cambridge [u.a.]|isbn=9780521670531|edition=Repr., pbk.}}</ref> :<math>T_B^{\mu\nu}=T^{\mu\nu}-\frac{i}{2}\partial_\kappa \left[\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial(\partial_\kappa\Psi^\ell)}(\mathcal{J}^{\mu\nu})^\ell_{\,\, m}\Psi^m-\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial(\partial_\mu\Psi^\ell)}(\mathcal{J}^{\kappa\nu})^\ell_{\,\, m}\Psi^m-\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial(\partial_\nu\Psi^\ell)}(\mathcal{J}^{\kappa\mu})^\ell_{\,\, m}\Psi^m\right] </math> where <math>\mathcal{L}</math> is the [[Lagrangian density]], the set {Ψ} are the fields appearing in the Lagrangian, the non-Belinfante energy momentum tensor is defined by :<math>T^{\mu\nu}=\eta^{\mu\nu}\mathcal{L}-\frac{\partial\mathcal{L}}{\partial(\partial_\mu\Psi^\ell)}\partial^\nu\Psi^\ell</math> and <math>\mathcal{J^{\mu\nu}}</math> are a set of matrices satisfying the algebra of the homogeneous [[Lorentz group]]<ref>{{cite book|last1=Cahill|first1=Kevin, [[University of New Mexico]]|title=Physical mathematics|date=2013|publisher=[[Cambridge University Press]]|location=Cambridge|isbn=9781107005211|edition=Repr.}}</ref> :<math>[\mathcal{J}^{\mu\nu},\mathcal{J}^{\rho\sigma}]=i\mathcal{J}^{\rho\nu}\eta^{\mu\sigma}-i\mathcal{J}^{\sigma\nu}\eta^{\mu\rho}-i\mathcal{J}^{\mu\sigma}\eta^{\nu\rho}+i\mathcal{J}^{\mu\rho}\eta^{\nu\sigma}</math>.
